thread.title: Asos delivers "impressive" Q3 sales performance

title: Asos delivers "impressive" Q3 sales performance
text:
Q3 retail sales rise 20% to GBP386m UK sales jump 27% to GBP158.4m Performance described as “impressive” 
Retail sales jumped 20% during the third quarter 
Online retailer Asos has said it expects full-year sales to be at the higher end of its forecasts, after booking a an impressive 20% hike in third-quarter sales. 
Total retail sales jumped 20% to GBP386m (US$596.7m) for the four months ended 30 June, compared to GBP322.1m in the same period last year, while retail gross margin improved 280 basis points. 
UK retail sales jumped 27% to GBP158.4m, while international retail sales increased 16% to GBP227.6m. Total group revenue grew 21% to GBP396.7m from GBP329m a year ago. 
"We have increased investment in our people and our customer proposition, particularly in relation to free returns trials," said CEO Nick Robertson. 
The company expects full-year sales to be at the higher end of its guided 15-20% growth range. 
Conlumino analyst Sophie McCarthy described the performance as "impressive," adding: "Today’s update reveals signs of a very promising full year update expected in August and shows that Asos has the flexibility and infrastructure to continue to grow in the face of setbacks; an important quality in the volatile fashion industry." 
While Berstein analyst Jamie Merriman said: "This is a strong set of results, given that the gross margin performance has recovered faster than expected and that management is confident that they can achieve the high end of sales guidance."
